example.name: standard
example.text: ''Mr. Sohmer confesses that it was partly in response to such attitudes that he is now ``a dweller on one of the two islands off the coast of America.''
example.arg: that it was partly in response to such attitudes that he is now ``a dweller on one of the two islands off the coast of America

example.name: inverted
example.text: [``When I saw the Lexus sales projections, I got worried,'']-1 confesses *trace*-1 Takashi Oka, who led the Infiniti development team.
example.arg: Takashi Oka, who led the Infiniti development team

example.name: prepositional utterance
example.text: During time off, Mr. Roman tends to his garden; Mr. Phillips confesses to a fondness for, among other things, fast cars and planes.
example.arg: to a fondness for, among other things, fast cars and planes

predicate.note: Frames file for 'confess' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entries say-37.7-1, confess-37.10.
